intro: Oxygraphis cymbalaria, commonly known as the common oxygraphis, is a perennial flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs and vegetables. The plant is characterized by its slender, branched stems and small, white to pale yellow flowers that appear in umbels. Its leaves are finely divided and emit a mild, spicy scent when crushed. Oxygraphis cymbalaria is often found in moist meadows and along stream banks, where it thrives in partial shade to full sun.
